properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for tonight. Snow at times heavy will affect portions of northeastern Ontario tonight. An accumulation of 10 to 15 cm is possible by early Monday morning. Over eastern sections of Manitoulin Island, the snow may become mixed with rain briefly overnight. Travel is expected to be difficult tonight and early Monday morning due to accumulating snow and poor visibility. Motorists are urged to exercise caution. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-28T15:07:06-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-28T01:08:06-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3772331901.2020
Area: Elliot Lake - Ranger Lake, Blind River - Thessalon, Manitoulin Island
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. An intense storm over northern Hudson Bay is bringing strong easterly winds to the Pond Inlet region. Winds gusting at times to 90 km/h are occurring in the region giving reduced visibilities at times in blowing snow. Winds are expected to moderate overnight. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-28T14:01:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-28T00:22:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0491924668.2020
Area: Pond Inlet

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Maximum gusts: southeasterly near 100 km/h in the Wreckhouse area. Time span: Tuesday afternoon. Remarks: Winds are expected to increase overnight tonight, gusting to 70 km/h before further increasing during the day on Tuesday. Wind gusts will top out near 100 km/h in the afternoon before quickly diminishing as winds shift to southwesterly. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions are affecting these communities. Conditions will improve in the evening. A blizzard warning is issued when winds are expected to produce blowing snow with widespread visibilities of 400 metres or less for at least 6 hours. ### Travel is expected to be very difficult or impossible due to near-zero visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for late this afternoon and tonight. Lake effect snow off Lake Superior is expected to develop this afternoon. Local snowfall amounts of 8 to 12 cm will be possible by later tonight. Westerly winds gusting to 60 km/h may create areas of blowing snow giving reduced visibility. The most intense activity is expected late this afternoon and through the evening hours when snowfall rates of a few centimetres per hour will be possible at times. Very poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow is likely. Travel will likely be hazardous due to rapidly accumulating snow and poor visibility. Motorists are urged to exercise caution. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-29T02:08:22-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-28T10:08:22-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2660991659.2020
Area: Searchmont - Montreal River Harbour - Batchawana Bay, Sault Ste. Marie - St. Joseph Island
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: An intense winter storm is bringing extremely strong north winds and blizzard conditions to Coral Harbour. Winds gusting at times to 90 km/h are bringing very poor visibilities in blowing snow. The winds will slowly subside overnight and the blizzard conditions will ease somewhat Monday morning. However some snow and blowing snow will likely continue to persist for the remainder of the day albeit with much improved visibilities. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-28T16:59:50-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-28T04:40:50-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0480113097.2020
Area: Coral Harbour
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory for overnight through Monday. Snow will begin after midnight and become heavy at times overnight or early Monday morning with a changeover to rain possible late Monday morning. There is also a risk of freezing rain overnight that may cause hazardous travel conditions. Snowfall accumulations by Monday morning are expected to be in the 4 to 8 centimetre range. Travel may be hazardous overnight until midday Monday due to rapidly accumulating snowfall and slippery conditions. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-28T21:19:39-00:00

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: An intense winter storm centred over the northern Hudson Bay is bringing strong north winds and widespread blizzard conditions to Kivalliq. The blizzard will end this morning at Arviat. The blizzard will persist at Chesterfield Inlet, Rankin Inlet and Whale Cove today and Tuesday and then subside Tuesday night. The blizzard will persist through the day at Naujaat. Near blizzard conditions will continue into Monday night. Baker Lake may be in and out of blizzard conditions today, but persistent blizzard is expected for Monday night and most of Tuesday. ### Travel is expected to be extremely hazardous due to reduced visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-29T01:16:24-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-28T09:16:24-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0282626784.2020
Area: Baker Lake, Arviat, Rankin Region including Whale Cove, Chesterfield Inlet, Naujaat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant snowfall tapering off this morning. Snow continues to affect portions of northeastern Ontario this morning, but should slowly taper off as the morning progresses. Total snowfall amounts of up to 15 cm are likely in some areas. Travel is expected to be difficult this morning. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-28T19:59:57-00:00
